summary: This is a joint submission from the prosecution and defense in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) proposing a juror questionnaire and voir dire questions. The parties request the documents be filed under seal, and the government notes it has produced Jencks Act material to the defense.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The signatory of the submission letter, representing the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Joint Submission of Proposed Jury Materials
events.description: The prosecution and defense jointly submit proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire questions to the court in the case US v. Maxwell, requesting they be filed under seal.

keyFacts: The document is a joint submission from both parties in US v. Maxwell, indicating cooperation on pre-trial jury selection procedures.
The parties request the proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire be filed under seal, suggesting sensitive content.
The government has produced Jencks Act material (witness statements) to the defense, a standard pre-trial disclosure.
The case is identified as US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), providing the docket number and judge initials.
